channel.title: Economy
channel.description: News, Analysis and Opinion from POLITICO

item.title: How Russia keeps raising an army to replace its dead
item.description: An online bazaar of freelance headhunters finds new recruits to fight Ukraine, emboldening Vladimir Putin at the negotiating table and scaring European leaders about what his growing army might do next.

media:content.media:title: Men walk past a billboard showing a Russian soldier participating in military actions in the Ukraine reading: "The pride of Russia", in St. Petersburg, Russia, Nov. 24, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By Ekaterina Bodyagyna and Ibrahim Naber
item.dc:contributor: By Ekaterina Bodyagyna and Ibrahim Naber

item.title: White House bullish on economic growth as Thanksgiving spending rises
item.description: Economic adviser Kevin Hassett dismissed economic bedwetters, saying strong spending bodes well for the economy.

media:content.media:title: Kevin Hassett said: “The good news around Thanksgiving is the sign of something that's stronger to come.”

item.dc:creator: By Jacob Wendler

item.title: Trump, stung by Republican losses, stands his ground on affordability
item.description: Democrats running on cost-of-living anxieties outperformed Republicans in Tuesday’s elections by greater-than-expected margins. The president chalked it up to partisan lies.

media:content.media:title: President Donald Trump speaks during an event about drug prices, Thursday, Nov. 6, 2025, in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington. (AP Photo/Evan Vucci)

item.dc:creator: By Irie Sentner

item.title: Voters on Tuesday rewarded Democrats who addressed economic costs. Hours later, Trump said he delivered an 'economic miracle.'
item.description: A recent poll found a majority of Americans feel they’re spending more on groceries than they did a year ago.

media:content.media:title: President Donald Trump arrives on stage to deliver remarks Wednesday during the America Business Forum in Miami, Florida.

item.dc:creator: By Ben Johansen and Kimberly Leonard
item.dc:contributor: By Ben Johansen and Kimberly Leonard

item.title: Reaganomics in Jersey: Jack Ciattarelli has a supply-side dream if he’s elected governor this week
item.description: The Republican nominee has promised tax cuts and economic growth, but the numbers are fuzzy.

media:content.media:title: Republican gubernatorial candidate Jack Ciattarelli campaigns in Garfield, New Jersey, Sept. 4, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By Daniel Han
